title: Forms: Viewing the Performance of a Form
body:
Forms: Viewing the Performance of a Form¶

Performance keeps a record of data associated with a form.

  1. Change time frame by clicking Last 30 Days, Last 60 Days, Year to Date, or Life to Date

  2. Hover over a data point to view number of responses on a specific date

  3. Click the number under Responses to see the contact associated with each form submission

  4. Click the number under Respondents to see the contacts who responded to the form

  5. View the total amount of money respondents gave through the form under Revenue

  6. The number to the right of the row entitled Unknown Respondents indicates how many respondents were not contacts of your team

  7. The number to the right of the row entitled Known Respondents indicates how many respondents were contacts of your team

  8. The number to the right of the row entitled Average Duration indicates the mean number of seconds spent filling out the form

  9. The number to the right of the row entitled First Response indicates the date and time the first form was submitted

  10. The number to the right of the row entitled Last Response indicates the date and time the last form was submitted
toc: • Forms: Viewing the Performance of a Form
